articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least 24 Palestinians in a tent encampment housing displaced families in Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, local health authorities said on Sunday, as mediators hosted a new round of talks between Israel and Hamas.
articles.title: Israel airstrike kills at least 24 in Gaza as mediators host ceasefire talks

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich, Valentyn Ogirenko
articles.description: The largest known Russian drone attack since full-scale war began in 2022 killed a woman in the Kyiv region and injured at least three people, Ukrainian authorities said early on Sunday, as Moscow stepped up strikes following peace talks on Friday.
articles.title: Russia launches war's largest drone attack after peace talks, Ukraine says

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Donald Trump's Middle East tour had a clear message for Benjamin Netanyahu: In Trump's vision of Middle East diplomacy, the Israeli prime minister could no longer count on unconditional US support for his right-wing agenda.
articles.title: Trump's Gulf tour reshapes Middle East diplomatic map

articles.author: Luiza Ilie, Elizaveta Gladun
articles.description: Exit polls showed Dan at 54-55% of ballots following a last-minute dash to the top after weeks of trailing George Simion, a hard-right supporter of Trump.
articles.title: Centrist Dan wins Romanian presidency over hard-right pro-Trump rival

articles.author: Ananda Teresia, Gayatri Suroyo
articles.description: The Indonesian government's plan to release new history books has sparked concerns that some of the country's darkest chapters could be recast to show President Prabowo Subianto and late authoritarian ruler Suharto in a favourable light.
articles.title: In Indonesia, fears grow that dark past may be rewritten with government's new history books

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The founder of the Telegram messaging app, Pavel Durov, said he refused a request by the head of France's intelligence service to ban Romanian conservative voices ahead of the country's elections.
articles.title: Telegram founder says France asked him to ban conservative Romanian voices

articles.author: Luiza Ilie, Elizaveta Gladun
articles.description: Bucharest Mayor Nicusor Dan's decision to attend a string of debates last week shunned by his hard-right rival appeared to pay off on Sunday when the pro-European Union centrist emerged victorious in the country's presidential run-off election.
articles.title: Romania's pro-EU president-elect known for calm, methodical approach

articles.author: Eliana Raszewski
articles.description: Argentine President Javier Milei's government received a show of support on Sunday as his candidate took the lead in a legislative election in the city of Buenos Aires.
articles.title: Argentina's Milei wins show of support in Buenos Aires election

articles.author: Kate Holton
articles.description: Britain is poised to agree the most significant reset of ties with the European Union since Brexit on Monday, seeking closer collaboration on trade and defence to help grow the economy and boost security on the continent.
articles.title: Britain poised to reset trade and defence ties with EU

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's foreign ministry summoned the British charge d'affaires in Tehran, state media reported on Monday, over the arrest of Iranian nationals and what it said were "false claims" levelled by Britain against the Islamic Republic.
articles.title: Iran summons British diplomat over arrest of nationals in UK
